metadata.title: CVE-2023-46848 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Squid is vulnerable to Denial of Service, where a remote attacker canperform DoS by sending ftp:// URLs in HTTP Request messages or constructingftp:// URLs from FTP Native input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-cgi - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-common - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-openssl - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-purge - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squidclient - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
